review_text: Had a great stay. Elizabeth was very responsive with any questions we had. It was the quiet weekend getaway that we needed.
Great place to stay! Beautiful home located right next to the river that makes you feel at peace with the nature.
We had a great weekend on the Rock River. Enjoyed the sights of the local state parks while celebrating our NIU graduate.
loved the location. Chock full of everything you might need for cooking. Bathrooms clean and nicely done. Rear deck and fire pit nice.

The river house was nice, and had a lot of great items in the kitchen for cooking and living room for entertaining. The grill didn‚Äôt work, but we enjoyed the large fire pit and they had a lot of wood to burn and cookware to put meat in to roast over the fire so we were able to make meals over the fire which was nice. Bring a lighter though because starting the fire was an interesting achievement for us day one, but day two we were able to keep it going from the night before. The water pressure wasn‚Äôt that great, but the bathrooms were fully stocked, and clean. The kids had a great time listening to records, and playing their guitar. We all enjoyed river view, their canoe is gorgeous, and while we didn‚Äôt catch any fish, it was a charming, cozy stay in a nice river home. Our children had a blast!
Beautiful riverside house. Comfortable and convenient. En plein coeur de la nature.
This was a great place to stay with a lovely river running in the backyard. Elizabeth was always responsive and so friendly!
Elizabeth‚Äôs place was great. We were in town to visit my grandmother for the weekend. We had a 5 year old and an 8 year old with us who loved all the toys.

Elizabeth was very responsive and flexible with check in and checking out. I got all the information that I needed before and during our stay at her home. This Airbnb is perfect for kids as they have many toys in the house and in the garage.

This was my first experience renting an Airbnb, and I couldn't be more impressed! Elizabeth was an exceptional host. She contacted me before the trip and gave me detailed information to make our check in easy and helpful information to help us make the most out of our stay.
The house was in pristine condition and had ALL the amenities you would need. Truly all you need to bring is food, the rest is already there to enjoy! You can tell that Elizabeth has spent a lot of care and time into making sure her guests enjoy their stay. She was very friendly and easy to communicate with.
The location is right on the Rock River and close to surrounding towns. You don't need to leave, but if you do, there are many things close in the area to enjoy.
I would absolutely book with her again!
This place nice and cozy, very beautiful inside and out!!!
Great place!
Great location- quite nice house‚Ä¶very comfortable! Lots of great hiking around and the local bars are comfy!
Place was wonderful! Felt cozy like at home and the scenery was beautiful. Elizabeth was very quick to respond to questions - a perfect host. Thanks again.
Perfect location surrounded by nature.

Elizabeth‚Äôs place was very nice, well kept and located not too far from downtown Oregon. It had everything we needed and beds were very comfortable for all six of us. The kids loved that there were toys & books. We will stay there again; especially in warm weather when we can enjoy the outdoors. Elizabeth was very quick to respond and a great host!

We had an amazing stay at this Riverfront Retreat in Oregon, Illinois! The spacious and cozy interior, updated kitchen, and delightful river views made our time truly special. The deck with a BBQ and the backyard fire pit added to the charm. The location is perfect, just minutes away from hiking spots and the river access is a bonus. The recent renovations and thoughtful amenities, like the pack-and-play, made it family-friendly. Whether you‚Äôre looking to fish, hike, or simply unwind, this retreat has it all. Highly recommend!
I really enjoyed the stay, felt a lot more at home than most places I stay for work.

We loved this home. It was very comfortable and perfectly met our needs. The home is pristine, well kept, with a very organized kitchen. It is as nice as the photos. The host was very responsive and helpful. 5 star experience all around.

6 of us went here for a girls weekend, it was perfect! The house was very clean & had everything you would need, if you chose to do any cooking, we did not we checked out the restaurants instead. There is a Great Mexican restaurant I highly recommend. Cute little shops to check out as well.
Elizabeth was very responsive to any ? we had. Definitely will be staying here again
We loved everything about this property. The home was very clean, tidy and had everything we needed. Elizabeth was very responsive and great to work with. We would definitely stay again!
We love the house on the river. We had a great time, the house was just it was described and the surrounding is just beautiful. We will be back.
Excellent stay close to castle rock with great view of river!
We really enjoyed our stay. Lovely spot on rock river with easy access to local state parks.

We enjoyed the beautiful sunrise and sunset over the tops of the trees each day. A bald eagle showed up around 4pm almost every evening to rest for while in full view across the river. A bird lovers spot with all forest on the other side of the river. My husband and I enjoyed cooking in the open kitchen. So nice to cook in a kitchen that is set up by someone that cooks. We especially liked the beautiful wood cutting boards. We both slept great each night. So private and peaceful. We reluctantly left to go hiking each day. We look forward to staying here again in the future.

This place was just what we needed. A countryside getaway in the fall at a beautiful property, furnished with all the comforts, with lovely indoors and outdoors. The place had everything for our family with senior parents to a 1 year old infant.
Elizabeth was proactive, kind and easy to communicate with, even in the middle of a major life event. She shared local recommendations and pointed us to various resources at home for our kid. We cooked, had a campfire, hiked at nearby trails, took walks around the property, and cozied up next to the fireplace with a book and hot chocolate.
Will definitely be going back for the summer!
It was a very peaceful place to stay. They were very quick to respond to any questions we had. I would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a nice peaceful getaway.
Loved the house! It was absolutely gorgeous, wish we didn't try and pack so much into the weekend so we could have enjoyed the actual house a little more, but it definitely worked for our needs!

One of my favorite airbnbs so far! I was looking for a waterfront place, and this country home by the river was perfect. My friend and I would take our chairs and sit and read or talk down by the river...so peaceful watching the river and the fish jump. The house itself is decorated with a quiet palette, and the way the kitchen is stocked with spices and pots and pans (even vanilla!) and the bathroom has extra toothpaste in a drawer, feels very thoughtful and welcoming. My bed was very comfortable as well. The only possible drawback, which doesn't deter me from coming back, is that there is some periodic road noise from Illinois 2, but you don't hear it in the house.

Elizabeth was a very gracious host for a post-engagement weekend getaway. It can sleep 8, but was a very comfortable place for 4. The kitchen was a joy to cook and socialize in, and the outdoor space was well kept.

We had a wonderful time at Elizabeth's home. The home was clean, comfortable beds, everything you need as far as cooking items and toiletries. Beautiful view of the river and great fishing on the bank right outside the house. Area is very private and peaceful, we would definitely like to come back someday. We had a little issue with the garage door and the DVD player and Elizabeth was quick to respond. Oregon itself was very nice also. Plenty of hiking, antique shopping and we did kayaking on the river....Thanks again Elizabeth for a memorable time!

We went with another couple for a quiet and relaxing weekend. Elizabeth‚Äôs place was just what we needed. The rippling of the river behind her home created a very relaxing atmosphere. Elizabeth was so accommodating and kept in contact with us before arriving to be sure our weekend met our needs and expectations. The home was clean,well maintained, and stocked with the essentials! Great experience.

The place is truly Paradise! Thanks to the owners for a wonderful vacation! The house is wonderful. Everything is thought out to the smallest detail. Very comfortable! The views from the house to the river, especially at dawn, were simply mesmerizing! The yard is well maintained and spacious. We really enjoyed spending time around the fire pit. Quiet and cozy place. We'll come again!!!
We had a great stay.

If I could give this place 6 or 7 stars, I would. With Airbnb filled to the rafters with perfectly acceptable but soulless accommodation, this is throw back to the platform's early days.
Elizabeth's house backs on to the Rock River, and it's off the main road so it's wonderfully secluded. Outside the main things we heard were cicadas and the river. It's so relaxing.
Inside, the house has been tastefully renovated and feels lived in. The kitchen is stocked with almost every item imaginable, the cookware is top grade, and there are plenty of condiments and spices to make tasty meals. (Side hint: get some local corn, it's crazy sweet and delicious.)
The couch, and beds are all very comfortable. And although we only spent a few nights here, we felt fully refreshed.
There's plenty to do at house too with canoes, a zip line, fishing gear, plenty of kids' toys, and board games.
Internet is available, but it's slow, which was great for our needs, but not if you want to work remotely.

There were a lot of things in the garage to use while staying here. We did go out and buy some bag-o bags because it looked like some mice got into them. We also brought some fishing gear because there were poles, but nothing to use to fish with. All-in-all it was a fabulous experience.

The house is very cozy and intimate and private, with a nice view, we enjoyed the backyard and spent most of our time outside. The beds were super comfy and clean, along with plenty of washed towels available in both restrooms, the living room area was also very cozy and comfortable. Elizabeth was also a great host, she was very responsive and made sure check in went well as well as check out. The River house also had everything you might need for your stay. We enjoyed our stay and would book again:)
Weenjoyed the peace and serenity. The house was perfect for us and our children.

We booked Elizabeth's home for a getaway and it was wonderful. It is quite charming. Her thoughtful touches made the space very homey.
Elizabeth was always responsive and made sure we had a nice stay. We would not hesitate to book again.

We wanted a country getaway for our family (kids aged 2, 4, and 7), and we could not have asked for a better time. The house is stocked with joys for kids: games, toys, a mini kitchen and chalk board, and even a vintage school desk filled with art supplies. The kids' room had everything you would need if you had smaller children: baby monitors, a pack & play, portable high chair, etc. Outside there is a mowed pathway along the river (no swimming due to the current) and the garage had lots of treasures for kids and adults alike: a canoe, fishing poles, a "bags" set, and other outdoor games. There is even a mini zip line my kids spent hours on, dragging one another back / forth. With four bedrooms, everyone slept comfortably and peacefully. There is a motion detector light in the hallway for middle-of-the-night needs. We visited during the Ogle County Fair, so between carnival rides, cotton candy, running/zipping around the River House, my 7 year old said it was the best day of her life!

My wife needed some time to reconnect with nature in a beautiful setting and a slower pace of life for a few days. This place absolutely delivered.
THE SETTING: the drive to the home through small towns, state parks and rolling hills is a retreat in and of itself.
THE PROPERTY: After you drive down a narrow paved drive, you come to a gravel road path which immediately reminds you that life is now slower and simpler and to pump the brakes and look around. The old home looks like a miniature farm house mansion-of-old. The pictures on the Airbnb site are nice, but pale in comparison to the actual charm we felt pulling up. Out back it's just you, trees & the Rock River.
THE HOUSE: Nice modern finishes coupled with vintage touches. The kitchen has everything you may need, most brand new, including a Brita in the fridge with filtered H2O, a stocked Keurig, appliances, etc. FYI there is no recycling on site. Upstairs there are four perfectly quant bedrooms with new bathrooms. We'll be back
Outstanding stay. Very clean and comfortable. Relaxation in a multitude of ways. Sit on multiple decks with a breeze, fishing, hot tub, sauna, fire pit, boating. Loved it and plan to be back.
The location was perfect for a weekend getaway, and Mike was super responsive.

This island home was perfectly secluded with 360-degree water views, private gate access. Mike, the host, was very responsive! Ideal for families, with plenty of games and child-friendly furnishings. Every detail caters to comfort and convenience‚Äîoffering a large communal area with multiple hangout areas both in and outside. Luxurious mattresses with extra linens and towels. Fully equipped kitchen with a complimentary espresso machine. Only a 9-minute drive to restaurants and a 10-minute drive to a golf course.
This island home is not just a place to stay‚Äîit‚Äôs a destination in itself, promising an unforgettable experience that combines the serenity of an island retreat with the comforts of a luxury home. It‚Äôs a must-book for anyone looking to unwind and indulge in the beauty of nature with all the comforts of modern living!
Was an amazing stay for friends or family. Private and away from ppl if you want a little get away. Beautiful and so many activities.
Perfect.

Great place for relaxing away from the city, 100% privacy, everything in this house exceeds our expectations, Mike was a great host, responsive time less than one minute.
Will come back soon!
Mike was a great host! His place is beautiful and really is a great place to gather. Good amenities and private.

Highly recommend; although a family emergency stopped us short of fully experiencing this unique home it is truly spectacular.
Highly recommend
Nice spot to hangout for a few days. We had a large group with several kids and everyone had a good time.

First, I'll give you the good- The place is a lovely house, and the location is beautiful. The site is truly an island and is very private.
However, I will tell you that my issue with this place was the mice problem. Every room had evidence of mice droppings‚Äîeven Some of the drawers in the kitchen. Twice in broad daylight, we saw a mouse running from one end of the room to the other. I understand that the house is by a river and the the first night, I told my kids, "It's because we are by a river." But then, I noticed how it was a bigger problem: bad. There are plenty of ways to combat this problem; there is no reason for this. It is very unhealthy for anyone staying there.
We had a large group and had plenty of space to be together. Home was clean and organized. Would recommend for others to use for a get away.
Awesome location and views! So relaxing and a great place for a good time with friends.

An absolutely beautiful property. Unfortunately 100 degree weather hindered using the sauna or hot tub. The listing said that the house was stocked and ready to go. Toilet paper, coffee pods, pots/pans, games, high chair. Everything we would need was there. It could be a little buggy out when grilling, but completely understandable given its proximity to the Rock River. Great experience! We‚Äôll definitely do it again. Maybe winter?
It truly is your own island! House has great amenities. Responsive host! But wish it was a little more organized and carefully kept for the price.

A nice house with many places to entertain inside and out. Plenty of beds, linens, pillows, an air mattress.
One bedroom with 3 beds has a small window A/C and there's larger window unit in the living room. It was over 100F outside when we arrived so it took a little time to cool. The bar and pool table rooms in the basement stayed cool though without A/C. I would bring fans for the other bedrooms if it's going to be over 90F but we were outside 90% of our time thanks to the kayaks, hot tub, fire pit, sauna, paddle boat, grill, smoker, fishing, etc.
Bring your own tupperware, Ziploc bags, and paper towels but otherwise the kitchen is well-stocked.
For kayaking, plan to walk back from the nearby boat launch if you leave the cove because if it's rained recently, you won't be able to paddle against the current to come back.
An overall great weekend with 8 of us, each in our own bed, which is hard to find!

We had a great time at the private island, which truly is private. Lots to do at the house, and Dixon is a short drive away. Mike was an excellent host. The house was very clean, and he was responsive when I had questions. I do wish the house had Wi-Fi, and the faucet water is a little gross. Regardless, I highly recommend staying here.
Easy check in process. Enjoyed the stay with friends on a peaceful island!

Unique beautiful spot on the rock river in northern IL. Plenty of space to spread out for the whole family. Linens and pillows were very comfortable. Hot tub and sauna with views of the river were amazing. River is really low from the lack of rain but kids still had plenty of fish to keep them busy. Large umbrellas on front and back decks were nice addition for warm sunny days. Assume being on the river with a shallow well and low water level may have caused the sulfur smell in the water faucets. Other then that wonderful memorable experience!
Great cozy place! Lots of space indoor and outdoors! I highly recommend for a family vacation.

This cabin style home is in a beautiful surrounding! The home is large and can easily accommodate a large group. The kitchen was lacking on utensils for a large group- but, we made do. Mike was extremely responsive to questions and did his best to make everything comfortable for us. It truly was a peaceful property and great house!
Beautiful property
Very nice place! Perfect for a girls weekend. Tons of space and the location was wonderful.
This cabin was the perfect place to relax and enjoy. Mike was a great host! Everything went smoothly, from booking to checking out.

This is a really cool property for a group of friends or family. The house is very spacious and being on an island offers great views and privacy. Would highly recommend to anyone looking to get away from the city!
This is such a gorgeous place to stay! We had plenty of comfortable space for our big family, and there was lots to do indoors and outdoors
Perfect experience for a private get away trip

Perfect place for a guys weekend! Beautiful yard and space with tons of seating options outside and inside. We loved all the amenities Mike had available (sauna, hot tub, kayaks, grills, towles, extra blankets, etc.). I would definitely come back
Had a great time, super nice home with much to do!
Mike was an excellent host! And his retreat is amazing! We may have to plan another girls retreat again next year! It was perfect for a gathering. We especially enjoyed the steam room.
Great place to stay, ill suggest it for more people.

Mike's private island was the perfect weekend getaway. It's located approximately 1.5 hrs from Chicago and offered awesome amenities for a guy's weekend. I'd highly recommend it for anyone looking for a fun and/or peaceful escape with a group of loved ones.
Great place to spend time with friends and family.
Great place for a weekend getaway. Sauna and hot tub were the best perks for our crew.
Very beautiful home !!!

we wanted to escape from our daily routine and to relax somewhere, this was the perfect place kind of unique private Issland surrounded by the beautiful nature ,inside nice and clean, hot tub and sauna was 5star , very nice place
Good host, beautiful environment.
Awesome place and great getaway!
Great place to stay, Mike was a quality host!

The Private Island House is a great opportunity to unwind on beautiful grounds with many amenities. It was very clean and the new furniture was pristine, as well as cozy. There isn't, however, a second living room with three more sleeping places. I recommend confirming with the owner about any changes to the property before you arrive, in case that has been updated. Our group was hoping to use the extra sleeping spaces so we wouldn't have to double-up, but those sleeping spaces didn't exist. Additionally, the hot tub was not in safe condition (brown water) upon arrival so I suggest you confirm with the owner that the issue has been resolved before booking your stay. Lastly, I recommend you bring your own towels as we did not have enough to accommodate our group.
We throughly enjoyed our stay. Everyone left happy and we‚Äôre hoping to book again next summer.

This was our second time staying at this property.
We will definitely be back!!
This house was perfect for our girls weekend! Plenty of room for our large group and everyone had their own space to sleep. Would definitely stay here again!

This was my second time at this location and this time it was with a group of girls and it was just as wonderful! We enjoyed being away from the hustle and bustle and just relaxing and talking with friends. Lots of wildlife and peaceful surroundings. Great space for playing games and sharing meals and just being together. Beds are comfortable and had all we needed in the kitchen. Loved the deck and didn't get to use the firepit but it looked awesome! We will definitely be back! Thanks Heather for a beautiful place!
Heather was very nice and responsive the entire time of my stay. Never had any issues from check in to check out. The house was clean and spacious to host a gathering.

This stay was incredible. There was so much space and the house was exactly what we needed. It is amazing for a larger group. The driving instructions Heather gave were very helpful and needed. The only difficulty was lack of towels, but everything else was sheer perfection.
Beautiful and peaceful place to stay. It was a little tricky to find, but with the directions given by the host it got you right there. Host was responsive and helpful.

When I first stumbled upon this AirBnB, it seemed almost too good to be true. I thought there must be a catch! Lol, But everything was as perfect as it seemed online. Heather is the most thoughtful, gracious host. She included all the information we may need from restaurant recommendations to surrounding places and things to do. It is the perfect getaway to disconnect from the world for a few days and enjoy family. Honestly I can't say enough about this place, there is more than enough room for a group of up to 16 people. The lounging areas outside & sitting in nature made it even better. Just 2 hours outside of Chicago. A quick & nice getaway for me to relax and enjoy my Birthday with family and the weather was nice considering it's February. Me and my family plan to return soon! If you came across this Airbnb and you are considering booking GO FOR IT! you won't be disappointed.
We loved this cabin because there was so much room for our large and growing family to sprawl out and run around in. Lots of new family memories made here!
Cozy, roomy, spacious, multigenerational. Our second year was just as great as our first visit. Heather is very accommodating and responsive.
Heather‚Äôs place was great for a large group. Beautiful surroundings with lots of space.

My family of 11 (inc 4 teenage grandkids who love space away from the adults) used Heather‚Äôs cabin for our Christmas get-together. The house is so beautiful on its own but Heather even went a step further by putting out some Christmas decorations and a 14‚Äô foot Christmas tree in front of the two story windows. Gorgeous. Lots of beds, 4 full bathrooms, big kitchen, big sectional with large tv in the living room, and a huge family room/game room downstairs for the teens. We live in 3 directions - all 3 hrs from the house - so such a treat to all be together in one house for 3 days. All in all - pretty perfect for my family. As we were leaving, my grandkids asked when we were coming back. I said soon.
Beautiful location to go to when you want to escape the city! No wifi‚Äî but if your goal is to enjoy nature and your family‚Äôs company, this is the place to go to!

This home was a welcome retreat for our family! We had 12 adults and 7 kids under 10 and there was plenty of room for us all. Lots of open space for us all to hang out together and spaces for us to get away as well. They even had a 12 ft Christmas tree there to help us celebrate!
Heather was a great host and she provided answers to questions ahead of time for us to be able to pack what we needed and even checked on us the first morning to be sure we were comfortable!
One thing if you have a larger group‚Ä¶be sure to bring some extra towels!
We will definitely be returning in warmer weather so we can enjoy the outdoor areas more!!
Thanks Heather for helping our family make lots of memories together!!
Have been here several times, and its always a pleasure.

Nestled in the serene woods of Oregon, IL, this secluded cabin offers a tranquil retreat. The rustic charm and cozy interior provide a perfect escape from city life. Surrounded by nature, the cabin's location allows for peaceful walks and a chance to reconnect with the outdoors. While its seclusion ensures privacy, amenities like a well-equipped kitchen and comfortable bedding add a touch of convenience. Ideal for those seeking a quiet getaway, this cabin provides a delightful blend of nature and comfort.
Amazing and beautiful place! Very spacious and peaceful.
Another great stay on the property. This was our second time back and we plan to come back next year!

My family and I stayed at this beautiful home, nestled away in the woods outside of Oregon, IL. Lots of room and beautiful outdoor space! Would highly recommend this property to others!
Thank you for being a wonderful host, Heather!

I booked this home for a wedding and it was great! We had a large group so we needed a big home to stay in and this one provided exactly what we were looking for. It‚Äôs very clean, comfortable and had plenty of room for a large group to stay. We have no complaints! The host, Heather was very responsive and she checked in on us to be sure everything was ok with our stay. I would stay here again!
Great place for a group getaway!

Had the place for the weekend and it was absolutely everything we needed it to be. Very clean, spacious, a short distance from Chicagoland area, and private. The kitchen is well stocked with everything needed. My family definitely wants to book again. Heather is a fantastic host and has a beautiful property!! 5/5

The lodge was a gathering place for our small wedding reception with family and closest friends. The space was beautiful, clean, and peaceful. We‚Äôre so glad this cabin was available for us and our guests. Everyone was impressed with the property and Heather provided very helpful instructions for finding the place!

This place is incredible. Beautiful location, comfy, cozy. Everyone agreed that this place was great. Heather was very responsive with any questions. The master bathroom was insane. Overall this place beat our expectations and I hope to come back to this spot again next summer.
Great house for a big group. Heather was quick to respond and accommodate. Pictures match the condition and size of the house.

It was a wonderful stay. We were 16 heads including kids. The property is very much spacious . Game room was fully staffed with games so kids enjoyed a lot. The surrounding is so calm and quiet and full of nature. Heather is very responsive. Overall we all are super satisfied and wish to come again.

Very spacious and beautiful secluded spot. We felt very at home with space to spread out. The layout was awesome and everyone had a nice clean bed and the bathrooms were very nice.
Lots of open stairs with No way to secure a baby gate- so a little stressful with little ones, but we made it work.
We really enjoyed our weekend and would recommend to anyone trying to get away.
The cabin is as spacious and accommodating as the pictures show. Heather is a very responsive host as well.
This was our second time staying in this home. Our family enjoyed this beautiful property! The yard is large and we loved the fire pit and deck. The house was very clean and accommodated our needs.

This was a really great place to stay! my only minor criticisms are the water system was pretty loud when being used and the cell service was kind of spotty. other than that, the place was very clean, spacious, and private. all of our guests had a great time. thanks Heather!
Great place for our immediate family of 7 and 3 groomsmen to spread out and spend a fabulous wedding weekend in a peaceful environment.

This was a great weekend and just a perfect place for our college families to get together. Our kids were able to meet for the first time and all the adults were able to jump right back in to college days like we never left. The house gave each family privacy with their own rooms but had the perfect size living spaces for everyone to hang out together as well. I hope we choose to use this place in the future for our yearly college get together s. The host was amazing. Timely and very helpful. Just a beautiful place and very private which made it even more peaceful. I would recommend this listing to anyone looking for a quiet weekend. 10/10 just awesome and thank you Heather for being an amazing host.
my daughter's wedding was occurring locally - this was the perfect place for the bride's family to camp out during the festivities

The cabin was a beautiful stay! We enjoyed every minute of it. There was plenty of space, a nice fire pit, and a cozy home. Heather was very responsive and made sure we had everything we needed. I definitely recommend staying here in the future.

Would be a very nice place if it was cleaner & better maintained‚Ä¶ air intake vent was caked with dirt; interior of fridge/freezer was disgusting. Found a mangled empty beer can in the ice dispenser. Took me an hour to clean the entire fridge before we could put our food in it. Mouse turds in some kitchen cabinets & drawers. Remote for TV was missing. Never did find it, but we found plenty of other nasty stuff under sofa cushions & beds. Faucets in master bath were very loose & the deck is deteriorating. Heather was understanding & apologetic and gave us a partial refund of the cleaning fee.
Love it! So nice house! Totally worth it!

What a great place to stay! Very convenient to Dixon and Oregon. We were in the area for our son's wedding. We were able to have my sisters and their families, and our mom and dad stay under the same roof. With all those people you could still find a quiet spot if you chose. It is difficult ult to find because GPS wants to take you through a neighborhood that the property backs up to , but there is no access that way. Heather was very clear in her check-in instructions to point this out and give you instructions how to get there. We only had trouble with those arriving after dark.
Heather is very responsive, flexible, and pleasant. We will definitely stay again when we are back in the area.

This place stood out amongst the rest. It was spacious, seclusive and well equipped. Most Airbnbs don‚Äôt have enough, towels, linen, cookware or any food seasonings but this place had it all. My family, friends and I had the time of our life. We laughed, cried and laughed some more. Made tons of memories and look forward to more. Heather truly was super responsive, thank you for being such an OUTSTANDING host. Don‚Äôt hesitate book this place NOW!!!

The cabin was great! We had an amazing time. It was such a good way to spend time with close friends. The cabin was cozy and we felt right at home. We will definitely be back. Thank you to Heather for being so nice!

Such a beautiful weekend to share with my closest friends! It is a stunning home and the host is wonderful to communicate with. I would highly recommend this stay to anyone who needs a relaxing weekend getaway!
Heather was a wonderful and responsive host. The location was exactly what we wanted, and the house was clean and able to accommodate our group. Would absolutely stay again!

My family and I really enjoyed our stay here. It was nice to unwind and relax. The cabin is beautiful and looks exactly like the pictures. Also it smelled great! Lol. Heather also provided nice recommendations for things to do around the area. I would definitely recommend for families!
Great place .. Heather is very nice and responsive

We stayed for a long weekend and came away very happy with our stay. The house had a great relaxing feel and had plenty of room to spread out for our large group. The beds were comfy and noise did not carry from the main living areas to the bedrooms. The kids loved the arcade game in the basement and the big kitchen was a great gathering spot.
A few things that needed attention. The fireplaces did not work, there were quite a few lightbulbs out throughout the house, one of the sinks was leaking, and one of the bathroom doors wouldn‚Äôt fully close. All minor inconveniences that didn‚Äôt make a big impact on the overall trip but should be fixed.
We had a great time overall.
The accommodations were perfect for our group. It's a lovely house for a large group, and the basement area is perfect for family activities.
Great place to relax, Heather was very nice to work with.
The place was great the amount of people we had. Great get together spaces along with private options.
Thanks Heather.

Loved the location and the home. There were a lot of requirements for checking out and cleaning - asking us to sweep, do a load of laundry, strip the beds, wipe the counters, which we felt were a bit excessive. Otherwise the stay was lovely! Also of note, the downstairs is extremely cold (like ten degrees more than the upstairs). But we didn‚Äôt spend a lot of time down there so didn‚Äôt really matter.
